body:
There is a very handy tool, written in Python and licensed under the MIT license, that restores point-in-time versions of a file or a prefix from a versioned bucket: https://github.com/madisoft/s3-pit-restore

I am posting this link here in case someone wants to borrow code from that tool and incorporate similar functionality in rclone. I can't do it myself, unfortunately.

Hello all.

Looking at this issue, i assume the support of S3 versioning is still missing.
Can anyone confirm?

Has rclone been validated against a S3 versioned bucket?
Does it work as with a non versioned bucket?

> Looking at this issue, i assume the support of S3 versioning is still missing.

It is, yes



> Has rclone been validated against a S3 versioned bucket?

It should work fine with a versioned bucket - the versioning is invisible unless you ask for it.
Thanks. Indeed it works fine (at least on a limited sample of data).

issue.title: s3: ls/mount -- support access to a specific version of a key

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
#### What is your current rclone version (output from `rclone version`)?

rclone v1.53.3-DEV
- os/arch: linux/amd64
- go version: go1.15.5

#### What problem are you are trying to solve?

be able to `rclone ls` (or more important - access `rclone mount`ed) files from S3 where multiple versions of a file exist (and likely differ).  Similarly, I believe, dropbox and possibly others do provide versioning of files (but not sure if exposed via API etc, never tried), so such functionality could be useful there as well.

#### How do you think rclone should be changed to solve that?

Provide 
- a command line option (e.g., `--versions`) for `ls` and `mount` to enable access to versions of the files
- some "semantic" for a file tree, so a user was able to ls/access a specific (not just current) version of a file. E.g., since unlikely to collide, could be just a directory named after the filename with `@` (or something even less to collide, e.g. `.rclone_versions`) where different versions would be listed.  Original file would be present as well, unless it was actually deleted (but prior versions still exist).  May be even aforementioned `--versions` could just become `--versions-dir-suffix SUFFIX` so it would be up for a user to choose its poison (and any non-empty value would trigger this versioning support)

<details>
<summary>e.g., there are two version of s3://openneuro.org/ds000001/CHANGES file and the latest is available (not a DeleteMarker):</summary> 

```shell
$> datalad ls -aL --list-content md5 s3://openneuro.org/ds000001/CHANGES 
Connecting to bucket: openneuro.org
[INFO   ] S3 session: Connecting to the bucket openneuro.org anonymously 
Bucket info:
  Versioning: S3ResponseError: 403 Forbidden
     Website: S3ResponseError: 403 Forbidden
         ACL: <Policy: openneurocommon (owner) = FULL_CONTROL, http://acs.amazonaws.com/groups/global/AllUsers = READ, rblair2 = FULL_CONTROL, http://acs.amazonaws.com/groups/global/AllUsers = READ_ACP>
ds000001/CHANGES 2020-08-21T20:27:29.000Z 286 ver:rgzXS_kxpT28qCt4vE3KfSoKDbRC9Na5  acl:AccessDenied  http://openneuro.org.s3.amazonaws.com/ds000001/CHANGES?versionId=rgzXS_kxpT28qCt4vE3KfSoKDbRC9Na5 [OK] 54904bf147105d8c8d2ef5903eeaadad
ds000001/CHANGES 2020-08-21T20:27:28.000Z DeleteMarker
ds000001/CHANGES 2020-08-21T20:24:13.000Z 291 ver:hdVjSXh5y7Z.SNYCW7G2T9sIPhu75yyw  acl:AccessDenied  http://openneuro.org.s3.amazonaws.com/ds000001/CHANGES?versionId=hdVjSXh5y7Z.SNYCW7G2T9sIPhu75yyw [OK] 63e3213153aa31569fb64710b0c9a113
```
</details>

If I `rclone mount` that bucket, I can only access the latest version:

```shell
$> md5sum /tmp/m-openneuro/ds000001/CHANGES
54904bf147105d8c8d2ef5903eeaadad  /tmp/m-openneuro/ds000001/CHANGES
```

but it would have been cool if there were smth like:

```shell
$> md5sum /tmp/m-openneuro/ds000001/CHANGES{,@/*}
54904bf147105d8c8d2ef5903eeaadad  /tmp/m-openneuro/ds000001/CHANGES
54904bf147105d8c8d2ef5903eeaadad  /tmp/m-openneuro/ds000001/CHANGES@/rgzXS_kxpT28qCt4vE3KfSoKDbRC9Na5
63e3213153aa31569fb64710b0c9a113  /tmp/m-openneuro/ds000001/CHANGES@/hdVjSXh5y7Z.SNYCW7G2T9sIPhu75yyw
```
then we could (ab)use in datalad to provide FUSE'ed access to git-annex'ed content (ref: https://github.com/datalad/datalad/issues/4003)

edit1 from a greedy me: I wish it was also supported somehow for HTTP remotes.  It will not be specifically a "version" but rather "pass additional parameters to HTTP call", e.g. like in the above example we have http://openneuro.org.s3.amazonaws.com/ds000001/CHANGES?versionId=rgzXS_kxpT28qCt4vE3KfSoKDbRC9Na5 URL, so if I could `cat CHANGES@/versionId=rgzXS_kxpT28qCt4vE3KfSoKDbRC9Na5` rclone would operate on a url with those additional parameters (so kinda like versions of the same URL) -- sure thing `rclone` would not be able to list any (until any requested) under that `@/` folder

body: I have posted my "vision" for versioning support, in particular for rclone mount, in #5064 (sorry - failed to find this issue when I searched for versionId ;-)).

issue.title: b2: Add b2-version-at flag to show file versions at time

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
<!--
Thank you very much for contributing code or documentation to rclone! Please
fill out the following questions to make it easier for us to review your
changes.

You do not need to check all the boxes below all at once, feel free to take
your time and add more commits. If you're done and ready for review, please
check the last box.
-->

#### What is the purpose of this change?

The goal is to be able to browse the b2 bucket state as it was at a specified point in time, using b2's file versions. This is especially useful in combination with other backup tools, such as restic, which may use rclone as a backend.

I have not added any tests, since I did not find any for `--b2-versions` which is similar functionality but I might be looking in the wrong place.

For example, this allows the following:

```
rclone mount --b2-version-at=2022-03-13T00:00:00Z b2:bucket /mnt/rclone
```

Or when using a backup tool such as restic:

```
restic -o 'rclone.args=serve restic --stdio --b2-version-at=2022-03-13T00:00:00Z' --no-lock mount /mnt/restic
```

To access pruned backup files whose data is still kept by b2 lifecycle rules.

#### Was the change discussed in an issue or in the forum before?

Yes, but not by me: https://github.com/rclone/rclone/issues/2126

#### Checklist

- [x] I have read the [contribution guidelines](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#submitting-a-new-feature-or-bug-fix).
- [x] I have added tests for all changes in this PR if appropriate.
- [x] I have added documentation for the changes if appropriate.
- [x] All commit messages are in [house style](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit-messages).
- [x] I'm done, this Pull Request is ready for review :-)

body: still no support? As i see, no

This is supported as you can see from the state of the issue i.e. closed: https://rclone.org/s3/#s3-versions

Please open a new thread in the forums if you are facing any problems using the feature rather than bumping closed issues.
